page.title: 13The Knepp Estate, Shipley.2.
page.content: Knepp has to a great extent survived as an integrated, private estate balancing commercial management with country sporting activities. Until 1975 two gamekeepers were fully employed to support the extensive, private shoot. The forestry management is forward looking and plantations provide softwoods for pulping and Christmas trees, hardwoods for building, fencing and maintenance needs of the estate. Knepp has good fox hunting country for the Crawley and Horsham Hunt whose opening meet is held at Knepp Castle. Knepp Mill Pond, a hammer pond of Wealden iron industry origins provides private recreation in the form of skating in Winter and income from the sales of coarse fish and eels when it is drained every five years.
